reviewText: I use Primal Mind in my World Religion class. I live in an area where we have many Native Americans and this is very useful in understanding some differences between the cultures. Promotes cultural understanding. Native Land, packaged with Primal Mind is not as good.

This is the second time I have bought this DVD--it is so good, especially for Anthropology courses I teach, that I just had to replace it after a "borrower" never returned it.  It is the best illustration of the Sapir-Whorf hypothesis I have seen.  "Seeing the world through different eyes" [a different culture and language] is a difficult concept to imagine, but this documentary does the best job I have ever seen.
I use the "Primal Mind" for my course on the psychology of the African American experience because it parallels well with American Indian thought.
Primal mind is an excellent documentary to understand how ancient cultures think. The other one, Native Land, I didn't like it at all.
